page.title: 20THE LOCAL POST OFFICE
page.content: I was appointed Post Mistress of Velindre in 1953. During this period there have been vast changes in the postal services in the area. In 1953 there were three part-time postmen employed at this office, together with one full-time Royal Mail van driver, who brought the mail at 7 a.m. to Velindre from Llandysul to be sorted out and delivered. The three part-time postmen delivered on cycles. In 1973 this office ceased to be a delivery office and all the mail is now sorted at the main Post Office at Llandysul and delivered by two full-time Royal Mail van drivers. This office covers a wide area, and includes the hamlets of Drefelin,Penboyr,Cwmpengraig, Cwmhireth as well as Drefach,Velindre. In 1953 95% of the population spoke Welsh, but today 50% of the customers are English {MRS A.DANIELS JONES
